cnd17:3.1: "[Like this Venerable Piṅgiya]": "Like this," the continuation of sentences; the

cnd17:4.1: "The eyes are unclear and the ears are uneasy": The eyes are impure, unclean,
cnd17:4.2: unclear, so that I can't see forms with my eyes. "Ears are uneasy." The ears are
cnd17:4.3: impure, unclean, unclear; in this way, I cannot hear sound with my ears.

cnd17:7.2: death, cessation, stopping, calming, non-living, and Nibbāna.

cnd17:9.1: "After seeing the person who is afflicted by form": "Form," the form of the four
cnd17:9.2: elements and anything created of the four elements. All sentient beings are
cnd17:9.3: beaten, killed, hurt, and tormented because of their physical causes and
cnd17:9.4: physical conditions. When there is form, various penalties are imposed:
cnd17:9.5: whipping, beating with a stick, beating with a cane, cutting off hands, feet,

cnd17:9.7: shell-baldness, Rāhu mouth torture, fire torture, candle hand torture, exorcism
cnd17:9.8: torture, bark torture, antelope torture, hook torture, money torture, alkaline
cnd17:9.9: bath torture, torsion torture, straw foot torture, hot oil, dog bites, the order
cnd17:9.10: to be pierced and beheaded with a sword; so sentient beings are beaten, killed,
cnd17:9.11: hurt, and tormented by the physical cause and physical condition. In this way,
cnd17:9.12: the person who is beaten, killed, injured, and tormented sees, measures, weighs,
cnd17:10.1: "[The Blessed One: 'Piṅgiya!']": "Piṅgiya": The Blessed One calls the Brāhmaṇa

cnd17:10.3: "greed breaker" is the Blessed One; the "sickness destroyer" is the Blessed One;

cnd17:10.6: pollutants" is Blessed One; "the one who has ended" is the Blessed One; "the one

cnd17:10.8: Blessed One; or "the Blessed One is close to the woods, wild forests, and border

cnd17:10.10: the human atmosphere, alone, and suitable for sitting alone" is the Blessed One;

cnd17:10.17: liberation, the eight victories, the ninth dwelling place, etc.; or the Blessed
cnd17:10.18: One is the practice of ten thoughts, (ten) abidings, the one who (observes) the
cnd17:10.19: in and out of breath; the one who is purely divided is the Blessed One; or the
cnd17:10.20: Blessed One divides the four mindfulness, the four righteousness, the four
cnd17:10.21: divine bases (iddhipāda), the five faculties, the five powers, the seven
cnd17:10.22: enlightenment factors, and the eight branches of the holy path; or the Blessed
cnd17:10.23: One is ten Tathāgata, four fearlessness, four unobstructed solutions, six
cnd17:10.24: supernatural powers and the six enlightenment methods. "Blessed One," this name
cnd17:10.25: is not given by the mother; not given by the father; not given by brothers; not
cnd17:10.26: given by sisters; not given by friends; not given by relatives; not given by
